channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Tree branches are hanging too low, 11th September
item.description:
All the other trees on the street have been cut back except this one. Branches have fallen off in the wind.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Villiers Road, Penge, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Would it be possible for Wardens to patrol Fernhead Road and Shirland Road?, 11th September
item.description:
Would it be possible for Wardens to patrol Fernhead Road and Shirland Road? Because these roads are rife with dog fouling. Despite you putting up signs encouraging dog owners to clean up after their dogs, many of these signs have been pulled down to pavement level! And they are ignored. Other streets that have these signs, they have not been pulled down! The culprits must live in one of these streets! I have actually had dog fouling thrown at the wall where I live and have had dog fouling put inside my dustbins! Thank you in anticipation.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 97, Fernhead Road, Kensal Town, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrowing, 11th September
item.description:
On a road that allows pavement parking…these are getting out of hand again. It’s bad enough the amount of Dogs doings spread up and down the street now you have to look up as well as and down.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Waldegrave Road, Crystal Palace, London

item.title: Cars blocking pavement, 11th September
item.description:
The shop called Drivy Number Plates at 5A Central Avenue treat the pavement as part of their workshop. Cars park completely on the pavement whilst people work on them . This is not a one off and when I report it the reply is a parking warden will visit . This is not a solution , they have little room in the shop so just take the pavement as theirs . Central avenue is a busy road and yet again I had to walk in the road to go pass this vehicle.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 126, Bellegrove Road, Welling, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree damaged by wind, 11th September
item.description:
Tree damaged by wind this afternoon, branch practically snapped off, but it is now overhanging and dangling very low on the pavement. The tree is on Stone Park Avenue by the 352 bus stop approaching Manor Way.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Stone Park Avenue, Eden Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Public trees need pruning, 11th September
item.description:
Several large tree branches fallen in the wind causing damage to multiple cars. Trees in this area need pruning. This has been reported several times before over a number of years, following falling branches in the past but remains an issue. Risk of further property damage and injury to pedestrians and residents. Thank you for kindly considering further council action.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Field Close, Widmore, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Mattress on pavement Wyndham and Bryanston, 11th September
item.description:
A queen size mattress was left on the pavement at the west corner of Wyndham and Bryanston.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 25, Bryanston Square, Marylebone, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerous driving on Chatham Place and Morning Lane, 11th September
item.description:
Drivers do not stop at the zebra crossing on Morning Path or at the junction from Belsham Street onto Chatham Place, making it a very dangerous area for cyclists. More stop and alert signs are needed to improve safety.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Belsham Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Union Jack flag tied to street light, 11th September
item.description:
Unauthorised attachment. It’s provocative and clearly a statement. One not reflective of the street and community.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Thayers Farm Road, New Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Ripped refuse bags attracting rodents outside wall of adjoining property, 11th September
item.description:
Outside building 170 Grove Lane, neighbours bins have been fly tipped. Ripped open by foxes and attracting rodents. Been there for 7 days. Neighbour does not seem to be in or engaging.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Grove Lane, East Dulwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street lights in alley way near Eden Lark station are not working., 11th September
item.description:
The street lights in the alley way are not working and have been out for last week. This is now very dark and dangerous as the evenings are shorter, there are children and old people who use this alley way and it could be unsafe.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 35, Oakfield Gardens, Eden Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Second report of abandoned car in Darwin Road Parking bays, 11th September
item.description:
I did report this abandoned car sometime ago which you referred to the DVLA as in appeared untaxed. It's stil there - new photo. You appeared to suggest it wasn't Bexley's problem, but I thought the Council were responsible for the removal.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): St Quentin Road, Falconwood, London
